title: Battle of Antioch: With the support of the Syrian legions, Elagabalus defeats the forces of emperor Macrinus. He flees, but is captured near Chalcedon and later executed in Cappadocia.
text: Battle of Antioch: With the support of the Syrian legions, Elagabalus defeats the forces of emperor Macrinus. He flees, but is captured near Chalcedon and later executed in Cappadocia.

title: Italy invaded by Attila the Hun
text: Italy invaded by Attila the Hun

title: Muhammad, Islamic prophet, dies in Medina.
text: Muhammad, Islamic prophet, dies in Medina.

title: Vikings raid the abbey at Lindisfarne in Northumbria, commonly accepted as the beginning of Norse activity in the British Isles.
text: Vikings raid the abbey at Lindisfarne in Northumbria, commonly accepted as the beginning of Norse activity in the British Isles.

title: Edward the Confessor becomes King of England, one of the last Anglo-Saxon kings of England.
text: Edward the Confessor becomes King of England, one of the last Anglo-Saxon kings of England.

title: Richard I arrives in Acre, beginning his crusade.
text: Richard I arrives in Acre, beginning his crusade.

title: Richard le Scrope, the Archbishop of York, and Thomas Mowbray, Earl of Norfolk, are executed in York on Henry IV's orders.
text: Richard le Scrope, the Archbishop of York, and Thomas Mowbray, Earl of Norfolk, are executed in York on Henry IV's orders.

title: American Revolutionary War: American attackers are driven back at the Battle of Trois-Rivières.
text: American Revolutionary War: American attackers are driven back at the Battle of Trois-Rivières.

title: Laki, a volcano in Iceland, begins an eight-month eruption which kills over 9,000 people and starts a seven-year famine.
text: Laki, a volcano in Iceland, begins an eight-month eruption which kills over 9,000 people and starts a seven-year famine.

title: James Madison introduces twelve proposed amendments to the United States Constitution in Congress.
text: James Madison introduces twelve proposed amendments to the United States Constitution in Congress.

title: Robespierre inaugurates the French Revolution's new state religion, the Cult of the Supreme Being, with large organized festivals all across France.
text: Robespierre inaugurates the French Revolution's new state religion, the Cult of the Supreme Being, with large organized festivals all across France.

title: A group of 194 Pitcairn Islanders, descendants of the mutineers of HMS Bounty, arrives at Norfolk Island, commencing the Third Settlement of the Island.
text: A group of 194 Pitcairn Islanders, descendants of the mutineers of HMS Bounty, arrives at Norfolk Island, commencing the Third Settlement of the Island.

title: American Civil War: Tennessee secedes from the Union.
text: American Civil War: Tennessee secedes from the Union.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Cross Keys: Confederate forces under General Stonewall Jackson save the Army of Northern Virginia from a Union assault on the James Peninsula led by General George B. McClellan.
text: American Civil War: Battle of Cross Keys: Confederate forces under General Stonewall Jackson save the Army of Northern Virginia from a Union assault on the James Peninsula led by General George B. McClellan.

title: Coronation of Franz Joseph as King of Hungary following the Austro-Hungarian compromise (Ausgleich).
text: Coronation of Franz Joseph as King of Hungary following the Austro-Hungarian compromise (Ausgleich).

title: Herman Hollerith applies for US patent #395,781 for the 'Art of Compiling Statistics', which was his punched card calculator.
text: Herman Hollerith applies for US patent #395,781 for the 'Art of Compiling Statistics', which was his punched card calculator.

title: Theodore Roosevelt signs the Antiquities Act into law, authorizing the President to restrict the use of certain parcels of public land with historical or conservation value.
text: Theodore Roosevelt signs the Antiquities Act into law, authorizing the President to restrict the use of certain parcels of public land with historical or conservation value.

title: Carl Laemmle incorporates Universal Pictures.
text: Carl Laemmle incorporates Universal Pictures.

title: Nova Aquila, brightest nova since Kepler's nova of 1604, discovered
text: Nova Aquila, brightest nova since Kepler's nova of 1604, discovered

title: A solar eclipse is observed at Baker City, Oregon by scientists and an artist hired by the United States Navy.
text: A solar eclipse is observed at Baker City, Oregon by scientists and an artist hired by the United States Navy.

title: Second Northern Expedition: The National Revolutionary Army captures Peking, whose name is changed to Beijing ("Northern Capital").
text: Second Northern Expedition: The National Revolutionary Army captures Peking, whose name is changed to Beijing ("Northern Capital").

title: Margaret Bondfield is appointed Minister of Labour. She is the first woman appointed to the Cabinet of the United Kingdom.
text: Margaret Bondfield is appointed Minister of Labour. She is the first woman appointed to the Cabinet of the United Kingdom.

title: World War II: The completion of Operation Alphabet, the evacuation of Allied forces from Narvik at the end of the Norwegian Campaign.
text: World War II: The completion of Operation Alphabet, the evacuation of Allied forces from Narvik at the end of the Norwegian Campaign.

title: World War II: The Allies commence the Syria–Lebanon Campaign against the possessions of Vichy France in the Levant.
text: World War II: The Allies commence the Syria–Lebanon Campaign against the possessions of Vichy France in the Levant.

title: World War II: The Japanese imperial submarines I-21 and I-24 shell the Australian cities of Sydney and Newcastle.
text: World War II: The Japanese imperial submarines I-21 and I-24 shell the Australian cities of Sydney and Newcastle.

title: Helen Keller, Dorothy Parker, Danny Kaye, Fredric March, John Garfield, Paul Muni and Edward G. Robinson are named in an FBI report as Communist Party members.
text: Helen Keller, Dorothy Parker, Danny Kaye, Fredric March, John Garfield, Paul Muni and Edward G. Robinson are named in an FBI report as Communist Party members.

title: George Orwell's Nineteen Eighty-Four is published.
text: George Orwell's Nineteen Eighty-Four is published.

title: An F5 tornado hits Beecher, Michigan, killing 116, injuring 844, and destroying 340 homes.
text: An F5 tornado hits Beecher, Michigan, killing 116, injuring 844, and destroying 340 homes.

title: The United States Supreme Court rules that restaurants in Washington, D.C. cannot refuse to serve black patrons.
text: The United States Supreme Court rules that restaurants in Washington, D.C. cannot refuse to serve black patrons.

title: The USS Barbero and United States Postal Service attempt the delivery of mail via Missile Mail.
text: The USS Barbero and United States Postal Service attempt the delivery of mail via Missile Mail.

title: An F-104 Starfighter collides with XB-70 Valkyrie prototype no. 2, destroying both aircraft during a photo shoot near Edwards Air Force Base. Joseph A. Walker, a NASA test pilot, and Carl Cross, a United States Air Force test pilot, are both killed.
text: An F-104 Starfighter collides with XB-70 Valkyrie prototype no. 2, destroying both aircraft during a photo shoot near Edwards Air Force Base. Joseph A. Walker, a NASA test pilot, and Carl Cross, a United States Air Force test pilot, are both killed.

title: Topeka, Kansas, is devastated by a tornado that registers as an "F5" on the Fujita scale: The first to exceed US$100 million in damages. Sixteen people are killed, hundreds more injured, and thousands of homes damaged or destroyed.
text: Topeka, Kansas, is devastated by a tornado that registers as an "F5" on the Fujita scale: The first to exceed US$100 million in damages. Sixteen people are killed, hundreds more injured, and thousands of homes damaged or destroyed.

title: The National Football League and American Football League announced a merger effective in 1970.
text: The National Football League and American Football League announced a merger effective in 1970.

title: Six-Day War: The USS Liberty incident occurs, killing 34 and wounding 171.
text: Six-Day War: The USS Liberty incident occurs, killing 34 and wounding 171.

title: Vietnam War: Nine-year-old Phan Thị Kim Phúc is burned by napalm, an event captured by Associated Press photographer Nick Ut moments later while the young girl is seen running down a road, in what would become an iconic, Pulitzer Prize-winning photo.
text: Vietnam War: Nine-year-old Phan Thị Kim Phúc is burned by napalm, an event captured by Associated Press photographer Nick Ut moments later while the young girl is seen running down a road, in what would become an iconic, Pulitzer Prize-winning photo.

title: Bluff Cove Air Attacks during the Falklands War: Fifty-six British servicemen are killed by an Argentine air attack on two landing ships, RFA Sir Galahad and RFA Sir Tristram.
text: Bluff Cove Air Attacks during the Falklands War: Fifty-six British servicemen are killed by an Argentine air attack on two landing ships, RFA Sir Galahad and RFA Sir Tristram.

title: Homosexuality is declared legal in the Australian state of New South Wales.
text: Homosexuality is declared legal in the Australian state of New South Wales.

title: New Zealand's Labour government establishes a national nuclear-free zone under the New Zealand Nuclear Free Zone, Disarmament, and Arms Control Act 1987.
text: New Zealand's Labour government establishes a national nuclear-free zone under the New Zealand Nuclear Free Zone, Disarmament, and Arms Control Act 1987.

title: The first World Oceans Day is celebrated, coinciding with the Earth Summit held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
text: The first World Oceans Day is celebrated, coinciding with the Earth Summit held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

title: Downed U.S. Air Force pilot Captain Scott O'Grady is rescued by U.S. Marines in Bosnia.
text: Downed U.S. Air Force pilot Captain Scott O'Grady is rescued by U.S. Marines in Bosnia.

title: Mamoru Takuma kills eight and injures 15 in a mass stabbing at an elementary school in the Osaka Prefecture of Japan.
text: Mamoru Takuma kills eight and injures 15 in a mass stabbing at an elementary school in the Osaka Prefecture of Japan.

title: The first Venus Transit in well over a century takes place, the previous one being in 1882.
text: The first Venus Transit in well over a century takes place, the previous one being in 1882.

title: Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia, is hit by the State's worst storms and flooding in 30 years resulting in the death of nine people and the grounding of a trade ship, the MV Pasha Bulker.
text: Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia, is hit by the State's worst storms and flooding in 30 years resulting in the death of nine people and the grounding of a trade ship, the MV Pasha Bulker.

title: At least 37 miners go missing after an explosion in an Ukrainian coal mine causes it to collapse.
text: At least 37 miners go missing after an explosion in an Ukrainian coal mine causes it to collapse.

title: At least seven people are killed and ten injured in a stabbing spree in Tokyo, Japan.
text: At least seven people are killed and ten injured in a stabbing spree in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Two American journalists are found guilty of illegally entering North Korea and sentenced to 12 years of penal labour.
text: Two American journalists are found guilty of illegally entering North Korea and sentenced to 12 years of penal labour.

title: At least 28 people are killed in an attack at Jinnah International Airport, Karachi, Pakistan.
text: At least 28 people are killed in an attack at Jinnah International Airport, Karachi, Pakistan.
